unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop comprehensive elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Greek language.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Greek at elementary level.
Identify, describe and evaluate some aspects of Greek-speaking cultures and societies.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use, in both Greek and in English.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Greek language practice. Students should be familiar with each week’s content before starting a new week. Class preparation time also includes time to study, revise seminar content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

assessments.description: This is the final test including grammar, reading and writing exercises, covering the content of Week 1-12. External students will complete online.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material. This will occur as part of regular scheduled seminar time.

The grammar tests are online tests held as a part of regular seminar time for both cohorts.

data.description: This unit takes learners of Modern Greek language from beginner to post-intermediate level. Its main aim is to consolidate the students' reading, writing, comprehension and speaking skills in Modern Greek acquired in session 1 and introduce new topics as well as further grammatical understandings of various tenses, the passive voice and the imperative. Vocabulary and grammar are taught through a communicative method. Students are also exposed to important aspects of Greek culture. This unit corresponds to the second level (A2) in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
